page.title: 09LONGTON FETE DAY
page.content: {Longton Fete}is held in late May. There is a procession of floats from 'Happidog' car park along Chapel Lane and Liverpool Road to the Victory Memorial Field for the crowning of the Fete Queen. Children dance round the maypole and charities run side shows like hoop-la, roll-a-penny and tombola, for their own funds. The floats in the procession are decorated by Guides, Scouts, youth clubs and playgroups. There are two brass bands and the Scout band plays for the walkers in fancy dress. The Queen is previously chosen from the teenagers of the district and walks, with her escort, at the head of the procession followed by the Rose Queens and Harvest Queen from the Churches. When the procession reaches the field everyone gets a free drink of tea or orange at the Bowling Club.
